description: Mika Greif, a 13 year old school student gets the first price at the pymove3D contest 2014 by his application Eiszapfenhöhle (icicle cave).
embed: <object width="640" height="390"><param name="movie" value="http://youtube.com/v/CJZhdLXw8cI?version=3&hl=en_US"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://youtube.com/v/CJZhdLXw8cI?version=3&hl=en_US" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="640" height="390" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true"></embed></object>
summary: The winner of the pymove3D competition is announced. The pymove3D competition  ran until May 1st, 2014. The goal was to write a Python program that uses the 3D capabilities of Blender.
title: pymove3D Winner Announcement
